name: TheAtlantic
text: “As the nation awaits a vaccine, the government may have no choice but to rely on Big Tech to compensate for its gaps in ability and expertise,” @FranklinFoer writes. https://t.co/eUgOlPQ2yh

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sandra and Lisa became friends while pregnant, and then “basically became a family unit,” raising their kids together and even moving in next door to each other. For The Friendship Files, @julieebeck interviews them—and their daughters: https://t.co/YRygam24U8

name: TheAtlantic
text: The big tech companies are eager to help the government respond to the pandemic. What’s in it for them? @FranklinFoer asks. https://t.co/w3xW4Vdcz7

name: TheAtlantic
text: Hollywood has made many Vietnam War stories over the past 50 years, but very few have dug into the experiences of black servicemen in that conflict. Spike Lee's "Da 5 Bloods"—out on Netflix—is a masterful film that changes that, @davidlsims writes: https://t.co/8klCp24Ce8

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If the first brick signals the beginning of a moral holiday for looters, the first thwack of a truncheon signals a moral holiday for cops primed to react to the unknown with fear and loathing," @gcaw writes: https://t.co/luQDtpYP3i

name: TheAtlantic
text: Bill de Blasio's turn from campaigning against racist police tactics to defending the NYPD’s crackdown on protests has disillusioned the city that twice elected him, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/aOBjgAUKe3

name: TheAtlantic
text: In our latest "Behind the Byline" feature, @edyong209 shares what it's like covering the coronavirus pandemic, how he got his journalism start, and the books and shows he's enjoying. https://t.co/QD0hEccEPD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Punk provides a kind of perfect buffet of opportunities to imagine yourself different than you really are—more engaged, more angry, more heartbroken." Andrew Martin talks with Thomas Gebremedhin about the role of music in teenage life: https://t.co/sGdXEt3egX

name: TheAtlantic
text: One biscuit tells a billion stories. @aliaallana tracks India's lockdown through the country's favorite comfort food: https://t.co/gWfgkhiebe

name: TheAtlantic
text: Rhythmic gymnastics on a British seashore, anti-racism protests across the United States, the funeral procession of George Floyd in Houston, a wildfire in California, idled elephants in Thailand, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/vRsb03AixE

name: TheAtlantic
text: Americans seem antsy to restart their lives, but this pandemic isn’t over. In the meantime: Here’s what to watch, read, and listen to this weekend. The latest Atlantic Daily, from @mimbsy: https://t.co/hv1DBmCgqy

name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week’s Dear Therapist, @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader with a long-distance boyfriend who tries to control her friendships and activities. https://t.co/rnz8xiM1he

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: "To identify the achievement and exhilaration in black life is not to mute or minimize racism, but to shame racism, to damn it to hell." https://t.co/qiLXkzQjAB https://t.co/hPFi1VqhFw

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: It's an astonishing contrast: SCOTUS just delivered a major decision protecting LGBT rights in the workplace. 

And this weekend in Virginia, the GOP booted an incumbent congressman because he officiated a gay wedding.
https://t.co/IrukyyBHEe
